intro: Velleia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth velleia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of swamps and marshes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Velleia glabrata produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in the summer months.
